title: Quarkus Lambda IT failing  with java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
body:
### Describe the bug

As outlined in the testing guide, https://quarkus.io/guides/getting-started-testing#quarkus-integration-test one could opt for running ITs against the built JAR. However this seems to fail currently when using lambdas. ITs ran against lambda with JVM builds fail with `java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out`



### Expected behavior

ITs ran against JVM build pass without problems.

### Actual behavior

```

```

### How to Reproduce?

1. Generate project using `code.quarkus.io`, add AWS Lambda extension
2. Replace `@NativeImageTest` with `@QuarkusIntegrationTest` in class `LambdaHandlerTestIT`
3. in pom.xml set `<skipITs>true</skipITs>` to `false`
4. in the project dir run `quarkus build`


### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Linux XS15-DQJ9ND3 5.10.16.3-microsoft-standard-WSL2 #1 SMP Fri Apr 2 22:23:49 UTC 2021 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "11.0.14" 2022-01-18 OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.14+9-Ubuntu-0ubuntu2.20.04) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 11.0.14+9-Ubuntu-0ubuntu2.20.04, mixed mode, sharing)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

n.a.

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.11.2.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.8.6 (84538c9988a25aec085021c365c560670ad80f63)

### Additional information

_No response_
